alert.note: Alert for Clay; Greene (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 6:53AM EDT until March 24 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Youngs Creek at Amity, White River at Spencer, Eel River at Bowling Green .Rain on Tuesday combined with rain overnight has led to flooding across several smaller streams. Flooding will begin along much of the White River in the coming days with flooding ongoing along Youngs Creek and the Eel River. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eel River at Bowling Green. * WHEN...From this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Lowland flooding is occurring along portions of the river. Sonnefield Road at McIntyre Creek is impassable. Water is on portions of Pioneer Road in the vicinity of CR 50 N. This level threatens campers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM EDT Wednesday was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this morning to 14.6 feet and then begin rising this morning. It will then rise above flood stage this afternoon to 15.2 feet this afternoon. It will fall below flood stage again this evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
